description.narrative: By the end of 2020, the government has strengthened capacity to coordinate and monitor the implementation of the multisectoral strategic nutrition plan at the central and decentralized level., which contributes to Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Micronutrients, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition And Hiv, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition (Covid), Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women, and children under five utilize quality nutrition services offering high impact interventions and promoting optimal nutrition behaviours.

title.narrative: By the end of 2020, the government has strengthened capacity to coordinate and monitor the implementation of the multisectoral strategic nutrition plan at the central and decentralized level.

description.narrative: UNICEF CO, in coordination with donors, United Nations agencies and civil society, continued to support the operationalization of a multisectoral coordination, monitoring and evaluation system for the implementation of the Nutrition Strategic Plan, through the acceleration of the national multisectoral plan for nutrition. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Existence of a national management information system that includes disaggregated data on nutrition, including sex-disaggregated data
Mapping of nutrition partners and interventions available
Annual planning and report for the implementation of the national nutrition strategy at national and decentralized level available
Website on the implementation of the national nutrition strategy available
Existence of a functional national multisectoral committee for nutrition
